message: YAY! I loooove mushrooms. As for my own deal-breaker: Sausage. Ew. Just...no.

Not a topping I would personally choose but definitely not a deal breaker. If you add some bacon with that mushroom then it is all good! My own deal breaker? Probably pineapple....you just don't mix sweet with salty. Just like maple syrup touching my eggs, breakfast sausage, bacon or hash browns....that is a no no!
Saw this question over on Serious Eats today and thought it would be appropriate for today's QOTD. So...mushrooms...yay or nay?  I SAY YES OMG YES YUM.
on pizza mushrooms are a no no.. but fried mushrooms alone are good :)
I normally pass on the mushrooms but it's not a deal breaker
raw tomatoes are a deal breaker for me
I forgot my deal breaker! PINEAPPLE. *barf*

Also, apologies for mixing two QOTD things in my head (no edit button!) and mixing the pizza topping deal breaker with "do you like mushrooms". I blame: 1) lack of coffee, 2) lack of sleep, 3) too much work on my desk and 4) all of the above.
@leah Do you hate raw tomatoes? They're one of my favorite things.
I don't think I have a pizza deal breaker. I love pretty much everything...
The British have been known to put corn on a pizza. I'd never choose that over another pizza, but if it was the only thing going, I'd still eat it. Close enough? :-p
I like mushrooms.  I don't think there's anything I wouldn't at least try and I can't think of anything I would consider a deal breaker.
I LOVE ham and pineapple pizza, @blogkitten does not. It has created many arguments where the point of 'fruit does not belong on pizza' is used.

@mistahsnart you can argue all you want, but in the grand scheme of things, fruit on a pizza is gross! Yes, tomatoes are *botanically* a fruit, but in culinary applications, it is a vegetable, along with cucumbers, squash, zucchinis, pumpkins, peppers, eggplant, tomatillos and avocados! :-P
